TEXT.TEXTVALUE: Point the mouse to each requirement to know the name –click/ the continue button to start the experiment.
Click any one of the button to move further.
Hands are sanitized with 70% ethanol and they are allowed to dry for 30 seconds.
70% ethanol is sprayed into the Laminar Air Flow chamber and is wiped with tissue paper.
The door of the laminar air flow is closed and the UV is switched on for 20 minutes.
Eggs in the incubator (38.5°C) placed in the laminar air flow chamber.
Opened the incubator and incubated egg (10 days) is taken out from the incubator.
Egg is wiped with 70% ethanol and placed it into beaker with the blunt end facing upwards.
Egg is wiped with 70% ethanol and placed it into beaker with the blunt end facing upwards.
A forceps is taken and it is dipped into the alcohol.
A forceps is taken and it is dipped into the alcohol.
Flame the forceps and is dipped in sterile BSS solution for cool.
Flame the forceps and is dipped in sterile BSS solution for cool.
Crack the top with the back side of a sterile forceps and peel off the shell till the edge of the air sac.
Crack the top with the back side of a sterile forceps and peel off the shell till the edge of the air sac.
Again resterilize the forceps.
Again resterilize the forceps.
notext
Peel of the white shell membrane using the resterilized forceps.
Then chorioallentoic membarane (CAM) and vasculature are removed by forceps.
Chick embryo in the egg shell is taken out using sterile curved forceps by grasping it gently under the neck.
The embryo is transferred into a 100mm petridish.
Pipette is connected with pipette pump and DBSS containing bottle is opened.
Pipette out 20ml of DBSS solution and closed the DBSS containing is closed.
20 ml is transferred into the petriplate containg chick embryo.
Two sterile scalpels are taken and dissect the embryo.
Arrange the organ rudiments around the periphery of the dish. From the right, clockwise, we have the following organs: brain, heart, lungs, liver, gizzard, kidneys, spinal cord, skin and muscle.
A 100 - 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
A 100 - 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
Fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
0.25% Trypsin solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
Test tube is taken from the test tube rack.
Test tube is opened and1000µl of 0.25% Trypsin solution is transferred into the test tube.
Tip is discarding in to the waster beaker and pipette is replaced into the rack.
Tip is discarding in to the waster beaker and pipette is replaced into the rack.
A forceps is taken and it is dipped into the alcohol.
A forceps is taken and it is dipped into the alcohol.
Flame the forceps and is dipped in sterile BSS solution for cool.
Flame the forceps and is dipped in sterile BSS solution for cool.
Take any one of the tissue from the petri plate and transferred it into the test tube containing 0.25% trypsin using a forceps, closed the test tube.
Take any one of the tissue from the petri plate and transferred it into the test tube containing 0.25% trypsin using a forceps, closed the test tube.
The refrigerator door is opened and the test tube containing 0.25% trypsin and tissue is kept in it (40C) for 6- 18 hours for incubation.
The refrigerator door is opened and the test tube containing 0.25% trypsin and tissue is kept in it (40C) for 6- 18 hours for incubation.
The refrigerator door is opened and the test tube is taken out from it.
The test tube is opened and carefully discarded the trypsin from the test tubes without disturbing the tissue, closed the test tube.
The test tube is opened and carefully discarded the trypsin from the test tubes without disturbing the tissue, closed the test tube.
The test tube is opened and carefully discarded the trypsin from the test tubes without disturbing the tissue, closed the test tube.
The test tubes are placed into the test tube rack and test tube rack is taken from the laminar air flow chamber.
The test tubes are placed into the test tube rack and test tube rack is taken from the laminar air flow chamber.
Opened the 37°C incubator and the test tube containing the tissue in the residual trypsin kept in it for 15- 20 minutes for incubation.
Opened the 37°C incubator and the test tube containing the tissue in the residual trypsin kept in it for 15- 20 minutes for incubation.
Opened the 37°C incubator and the test tube containing the tissue in the residual trypsin kept in it for 15- 20 minutes for incubation.
Opened the 37°C incubator and the test tube containing the tissue in the residual trypsin kept in it for 15- 20 minutes for incubation.
Opened the 37°C incubator and the test tube containing the tissue in the residual trypsin kept in it for 15- 20 minutes for incubation.
The incubator door is opened and the test tube is taken out from it.
The incubator door is opened and the test tube is taken out from it.
Incubator door is closed and then the test tube is placed in to the laminar air flow chamber.
Two petri plates is opened in the laminar air flow chamber.
A 100- 2000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
A 100- 2000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
A fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
DMEM media containing bottle is opened and 2000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the petriplate.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the other petriplate.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the other petriplate.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the test tube containing tissue and the residual trypsin and mixing the solution well using the same pipette.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the test tube containing tissue and the residual trypsin and mixing the solution well using the same pipette.
Similarly same amount of DMEM media is poured into the test tube containing tissue and the residual trypsin and mixing the solution well using the same pipette.
Then 1000 µl of this solution is poured into the petriplate and mixing the solution well using pipettes.
notext
Similarly same amount is transferred into the petriplate and mixing the solution well using pipettes.
Similarly same amount is transferred into the petriplate and mixing the solution well using pipettes.
Similarly same amount is transferred into the petriplate and mixing the solution well using pipettes.
Petri plates are closed.
Petriplate is taken from the laminar air flow chamber.
CO₂ Incubator is opened and the Petri plates are kept in it for overnight incubation, then the CO₂ incubator is closed.
CO₂ Incubator is opened and the Petri plates are kept in it for overnight incubation, then the CO₂ incubator is closed.
CO₂ Incubator is opened and the Petri plates are kept in it for overnight incubation, then the CO₂ incubator is closed.
notext
notext
A petriplate is taken from the CO₂ incubator and place it on the inverted microscope.
A petriplate is taken from the CO₂ incubator and place it on the inverted microscope.
Plate is viewed under inverted microscope for checking the confluency of plate.
Plate is taken from the microscope and is kept in to the CO₂ Incubator, close it.
Plate is taken from the microscope and is kept in to the CO₂ Incubator, close it.
Plate is taken from the microscope and is kept in to the CO₂ Incubator, close it.
And incubate for 5 – 7 days till we get a confluent culture (change the medium in every 3 days).
After incubation, CO₂ incubator is opened and a petriplate is taken from the CO₂ incubator.
After incubation, CO₂ incubator is opened and a petriplate is taken from the CO₂ incubator.
Petriplate is place on the inverted microscope and viewed under inverted microscope.
Petriplate is place on the inverted microscope and viewed under inverted microscope.
Click any one of the button to move further.
Hands are sanitized with 70% ethanol and they are allowed to dry for 30 seconds.
70% ethanol is sprayed into the Laminar Air Flow chamber and is wiped with tissue paper.
The door of the laminar air flow is closed and the UV is switched on for 20 minutes.
All the materials required for the experiment are arranged inside the laminar air flow chamber.
A 100 - 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
A 100 - 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and is adjusted to 1000µl.
A fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
5% bleach solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of 5% bleach solution in to it.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of 5% bleach solution in to it.
Treat the embryo with 1000µl 0.5% bleach solution for 2minutes.
Decant the solution from the petriplate using pipette and placed it in to the laminar air flow chamber.
Decant the solution from the petriplate using pipette and placed it in to the laminar air flow chamber.
Decant the solution from the petriplate using pipette and placed it in to the laminar air flow chamber.
The tip and solution is discarded in to the waster beaker.
A fresh tip is taken from the tip box and Hank’s saline solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
A fresh tip is taken from the tip box and Hank’s saline solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
notext
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of Hank’s saline solution in to it.
Then mix the solution in the petri plate very well and the solution is decanting using pipette.
notext
The tip and solution is discarded in to the waster beaker and is replaced.
The tip and solution is discarded in to the wast beaker and is replaced.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate and another 60mm sterile petri plate is opened in the laminar air flow chamber.
Two sterile scalpels are taken and all embryo is transferred in to another 60mm sterile petriplate.
Two sterile scalpels are taken and all embryo is transferred in to another 60mm sterile petriplate.
Two sterile scalpels are taken and all embryo is transferred in to another 60mm sterile petriplate.
Two sterile scalpels are taken and all embryo is transferred in to another 60mm sterile petriplate.
Forceps is replaced into the laminar air flow chamber.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is taken and placed it under the simple binocular microscope.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is taken and placed it under the simple binocular microscope.
Plate is viewed under simple binocular microscope and removes the chorion from the entire embryo using watchmaker’s forceps.
Plate is viewed under simple binocular microscope and removes the chorion from the entire embryo using watchmaker’s forceps.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is replaced in to the laminar air flow chamber and is closed.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is replaced in to the laminar air floe chamber and is closed.
A 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and a fresh tip is inserted into it.
A 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and a fresh tip is inserted into it.
Calcium free Ringer’s solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of Calcium free Reinger’s solution in to it.
Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of Calcium free Reinger’s solution in to it.
Then mix the solution in the petri plate very well and the solution is decanted using pipette.
notext
The tip and solution is discarded in to the waster beaker and a fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
The tip and solution is discarded in to the waster beaker and a fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
Again Calcium free Reinger’s solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.

Zebra fish embryo containing petri plate is opened and transfer 1000µl of Calcium free Reinger’s solution in to it.The Zebra fish embryo is sucking by using pasture pipette and transfer into another sterile petri plate.
The Zebra fish embryo is sucking by using pasture pipette and transfer into another sterile petri plate.
Again the Zebra fish embryo is sucking by using pasture pipette and transfer into another sterile petri plate.
Again the Zebra fish embryo is sucking by using pasture pipette and transfer into another sterile petri plate.
A sterile cover slip is taken from the cover slip box and the cover slip is placed over the embryos And smash it with hands and the cover slip is removed by using the forceps.
A 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and a fresh tip is inserted into it.
A 1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and a fresh tip is inserted into it.
Calcium free Reinger’s solution containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
Zebra fish embryos containing petri plate is opened and gently poured 1000µl of Calcium free Reinger’s solution in to it.
Then swirled the petri plate containing Zebra fish embryos and replaced it in to the laminar air flow chamber.
Then swirled the petri plate containing Zebra fish embryos and replaced it in to the laminar air flow chamber.
The tip is discarded in to the waster beaker and a fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
The tip is discarded in to the waster beaker and a fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
The Zebra fish embryos and Calcium free Reinger’s solution (suspension) is pipette out from the Petri plate.
An eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and the suspension is poured into it.
An eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and the suspension is poured into it.
The centrifuge is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension and balancing tube is placed in it,
The centrifuge is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension and balancing tube is placed in it,
The centrifuge is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension and balancing tube is placed in it,
The centrifuge is closed and it is adjusted to the speed at 300x g and time 7 minute, then start it.
The centrifuge is closed and it is adjusted to the speed at 300x g and time 7 minute, then start it.
The eppendorf tube is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension is taken out from the centrifuge.
The eppendorf tube is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension is taken out from the centrifuge.
The supernatant is discarded in to the waste beaker.
The remaining suspension is mixed using the pasture pipette, close it.
The remaining suspension in eppendorf tub is replaced into the laminar air flow chamber.
A 100-1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and 1000 µl is adjusted to it.
A 100-1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and 1000 µl is adjusted to it.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
L-15 media containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
The remaining suspension in eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and poured the L-15 media into it, and mix well.
The remaining suspension in eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and poured the L-15 media into it, and mix well.
The centrifuge is opened and the remaining suspension in eppendorf tube and balancing tube is placed in it.
The centrifuge is opened and the remaining suspension in eppendorf tube and balancing tube is placed in it.
The centrifuge is closed and it is adjusted to the speed at 300x g and time 7 minute and start it.
The centrifuge is closed and it is adjusted to the speed at 300x g and time 7 minute and start it.
The centrifuge tube is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension is taken out from the centrifuge.
The centrifuge tube is opened and the eppendorf tube containing suspension is taken out from the centrifuge.
The supernatant is discarded in to the waste beaker.
The remaining precipitate in eppendorf tub is replaced into the laminar air flow chamber.
A 100-1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and 1000 µl is adjusted to it.
A 100-1000 µl pipette is taken from the pipette rack and 1000 µl is adjusted to it.
A fresh tip is inserted into the pipette.
Again L-15 media containing bottle is opened and 1000µl is pipette out from the bottle, close it.
The remaining precipitate in eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and poured the L-15 media into it, and mix well.
Remaining precipitate in eppendorf tube is taken from the rack and poured the L-15 media into it, and mix well.
notext
Screw cap tube is taken from the rack.
The tube is opened and pipette containing solution is added to it.
The tube is closed and is replaced into the rack.
The tip is discarded into the waste beaker.
A fresh tip is taken from the tip box.
The bottle containing L- 15 media with serum is opened 1000µl of taken from it.
notext
The tube is opened and 1000µl of L- 15 media is added into it.
The tube is closed and the solution in the tube is mixed by shaking.
The petriplate is opened and the solution in the tube is transferred into it. Then the plate is closed.
Incubator (28.5°C)
The incubator is opened and the Petri plate is placed in it.
The incubator is opened and the Petri plate is placed in it.
The incubator is closed and the cells are incubated overnight at 28.5°C.
The incubator is closed and the cells are incubated overnight at 28.5°C.
Incubator is opened and the Petri plate is taken out from the incubator.
Incubator is opened and the Petri plate is taken out from the incubator.
The plate is placed under an inverted microscope.
The cells are observed through an inverted microscope.
The Petri plate is taken from the inverted microscope.
The incubator is opened and the Petri plate is placed in it.
The incubator is opened and the Petri plate is placed in it.
The incubator is closed and the cells are incubated for 5-7 days at 28.5°C. ( Change the media every 3 days).
The incubator is closed and the cells are incubated for 5-7 days at 28.5°C. ( Change the media every 3 days).
Incubator is opened and the Petri plate is taken out from the incubator.
Incubator is opened and the Petri plate is taken out from the incubator.
The plate is placed under an inverted microscope.
The cells are observed through an inverted microscope.
